abstract.t: Full service resolver uses x509 certificate to provide DNS over TLS DNS over DTLS . This memo describes How to accept this certificate.

section.title: full service resolver certificate
section.t: The certificate common name can be decided freely. Add TLSA record of the certificate to full resolver service IP address reverse name. Tha TLSA record MUST validate DNSSEC.

section.title: accepting full service resolver certificate
section.t: Stub resolver begins the TLS handshake and receives Full resolver certificate. Stub resolver requests TLSA record of full resolver service IP address reverse name and validates the TLSA recedes itself using. This process can use not safety Server. If the TLSA recedes are not validate, Stub resolver deny this certificate. If the TLSA recedes are secure and The TLSA recedes include recede of handshake certificate, Stub resolver accept this certificate.

section.title: Distribution and update root trust anchor
section.t: Root trust anchor distribution and update SHOULD update by OS periodic update.

section.title: Method of using TLS-PKI - HTTPS style
full service resolver certificate
section.t: The certificate common name is full resolver service IP address reverse name. Full resolver uses different certificate depending base on IP address.

section.title: accepting full service resolver certificate
section.t: Stub resolver begins the TLS handshake and receives Full resolver certificate. Stub resolver accepts this certificate by root certificates on OS defaults.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: Both authoritative server and resolvers that implement LB SHOUD carefully check for loops.
